msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Numbers 10
ab.l:
And
the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Make you
two trumpets of silver. You shall make them of hammered work and they shall be
for you for the calling of the congregation and for the journeying of the
camps.

And when they shall blow with them, all the
congregation shall be gathered to you, to the door of the tent of meeting.

And if they blow with one, then all the princes,
the superiors of the thousands of Israel, shall be gathered to you.

When you blow a calling, then the camps that
are camping toward the rising of the sun shall set out.

And you shall blow
a calling a second time, and the camps
that lie southward shall set out. They shall blow a calling
in the time of their travels.

But when
the assembly is to be gathered, you shall blow, but you shall not call.

And the sons
of Aaron, the priests, shall blow with the trumpets, and they shall be
to you for an eternal statute throughout your generations.

And if you come to war in your land against the enemy
that oppresses you, then you shall call with the trumpets, and
you shall be remembered before the Lord your God, and you shall be saved
from your enemies.

Also in the day of your gladness, and in your holidays, and
on your new moons: you shall blow with the trumpets next to your burnt offerings
and next to the sacrifices of your peace offerings, and they shall be to you
for a memorial before your God. I am the Lord your God.

And
it was in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth
day of the month: the cloud was lifted from off the tabernacle
of the law.

And the children of Israel set out
on their travels from the wilderness of Sinai. And the cloud camped
in the wilderness of Paran.

And they set out first
according to the command of the Lord by the prophecy of Moses.

The standard of the camp of the sons of Judah set out
first according to their armies, and the superior over its army was
Nahshon, son of Amminadab.

And the superior over the army
of the tribe of the sons of Issachar was Nethanel, son of Zuar.

And the superior over the army of the tribe of the sons
of Zebulun was Eliab, son of Helon.

And the
tabernacle was taken down, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari
set out who carried the tabernacle.

And
the standard of the camp of Reuben set out according to their armies, and the superior over its army
was Elizur, son of Shedeur.

And
over the army of the tribe of the sons of Simeon was
Shelumiel, son of Zurishaddai.

And the superior over the army
of tribe of the sons of Gad was Eliasaph, son of Deuel.

And the Kohathites set out who carried
the tabernacle. And the sons of Gershon and the sons of
Merari set up the tabernacle as they came.

And the standard of the camp of the sons of Ephraim set out
according to their armies, and the superior over its army was Elishama, son
of Ammihud.

And the superior over the army of the tribe
of the sons of Manasseh was Gamaliel, son of Pedahzur.

And the superior over the army of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin was
Abidan, son of Gideoni.

And the standard of the camp
of the sons of Dan set out who were assembling all the camps
according their armies, and the superior over its army was Ahiezer,
son of Ammishaddai.

And the superior over the army
of the tribe of the sons of Asher was Pagiel, son of Ocran.

And the superior over the army of the tribe of the sons
of Naphtali was Ahira, son of Enan.

These were
the travels of the sons of Israel according to their armies, and they set out.

And Moses said to Hobab, son of Reuel,
the Midianite, Moses’ father in law, saying, ‘We are setting out
to the place of which the Lord said, “I will give it to you.”
Come with us, and we will do you good, for the Lord has spoken
good concerning Israel.’

And he said to him,
‘I will not go, but I will depart to my own land and to my kindred.’

And he said, ‘Do not leave us, I pray you, because
you knew how we camped in the wilderness, and you were eyes
for us.

And it shall be, if you go with us,
it shall be, that what goodness the Lord shall do with us,
the same we will do to you.’

And they set out from the mountain
of the Lord three days’ journey. And the ark of the covenant of the Lord travelled
before them in the three days’ journey, to look out for a rest|ing place| for them.

And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day,
when they set out from the camp.

And it was,
when the ark travelled, that Moses said, ‘Rise up, oh Lord, and
let your enemies be scattered, and let them that hate you flee
before you.’

And when it camped, he said, ‘Quieten,
oh Lord, the ten thousands of thousands of Israel.’
